title: In Their Own Words
preview: Listen to what they said and make up your own mind.
body:
[![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!1GpO!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F9e1a12e1-245d-47ee-8cd3-9f99689e54c3_1920x1080.webp)](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!1GpO!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F9e1a12e1-245d-47ee-8cd3-9f99689e54c3_1920x1080.webp)

The statements weren’t whispered. They were said into microphones, posted online, repeated at rallies, and carried live on national television. Over time, they stacked up — speech after speech, post after post — until they began to form a pattern that speaks for itself.

What follows isn’t commentary or argument. It’s a record assembled from publicly available transcripts, verified reporting, and direct public statements. The quotations appear in full or contextually complete excerpt and are presented chronologically.

Read alone, many sounded like politics — sharp, emotional, sometimes theatrical. Read together, they tell a different kind of story. One about how language changes what people accept. How lines move. How ideas that once sounded extreme can start to sound ordinary.

This is that record. Presented in sequence. Just the words themselves — laid side by side and allowed to stand long enough to be heard.

***

**Exclusion — Fully Formed**

> **2025 — Kristi Noem — Public immigration statement**
>
> “I just met with the President. I am recommending a full travel ban on every damn country that’s been flooding our nation with killers, leeches, and entitlement junkies.
>
> Our forefathers built this nation on blood, sweat, and the unyielding love of freedom — not for foreign invaders to slaughter our heroes, suck dry our hard-earned tax dollars, or snatch the benefits owed to AMERICANS.
>
> WE DON’T WANT THEM. NOT ONE.”¹⁷

***

**Policy Moves to Identity**

> **2015 — Donald J. Trump — Campaign policy announcement**
>
> “Trump is calling for a total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States until our country’s representatives can figure out what is going on.”¹

***

**Nationality Becomes the Filter**

> **2018 — Donald J. Trump — White House immigration meeting**
>
> “Why are we having all these people from shithole countries come here? Why do we need more Haitians? Take them out. Why do we want all these people from Africa here? We should have more people from places like Norway.”²

***

**Belonging Becomes Conditional**

> **2019 — Donald J. Trump — Tweet**
>
> “Why don’t they go back and help fix the totally broken and crime infested places from which they came.”³

***

**Nationality Expands into Civilization**

> **2020 — Pete Hegseth — American Crusade**
>
> “Islam is not a religion of peace, and it never has been… Islamists plan to demographically, culturally, and politically conquer Europe and America.”⁴

***

**The Framing Becomes Existential**

> **2025 — Stephen Miller — Immigration statement**
>
> “This is the great lie of mass migration. You are not just importing individuals. You are importing societies. No magic transformation occurs when failed states cross borders. At scale, migrants and their descendants recreate the conditions and terrors of their broken homelands.”⁵

***

**The Language Becomes Biological**

> **2023 — Donald J. Trump — Campaign rally**
>
> “They’re poisoning the blood of our country… They’re coming into our country from Africa, from Asia, from South America, from all over the world. They’re poisoning the blood of our country.”⁶

***

**Political Opposition Becomes Infestation**

> **2023 — Donald J. Trump — Veterans Day speech**
>
> “We pledge to you that we will root out the communists, Marxists, fascists, and the radical left thugs that live like vermin within the confines of our country.”⁷

***

**Leadership Becomes Singular**

> **2023 — Donald J. Trump — CPAC speech**
>
> “I am your warrior. I am your justice. And for those who have been wronged and betrayed, I am your retribution.”⁸

***

**Authoritarian Rule Is No Longer Hypothetical**

> **2022 — Donald J. Trump — Truth Social post**
>
> “A Massive Fraud of this type and magnitude allows for the termination of all rules, regulations, and articles, even those found in the Constitution.”⁹

***

**Admiration for Strongman Leadership Appears Openly**

> **2018 — Donald J. Trump — Donor meeting**
>
> “He’s now president for life… I think it’s great. Maybe we’ll have to give that a shot someday.”¹⁰
>
> **2018 — Donald J. Trump — Rally referencing North Korea**
>
> “He speaks and his people sit up at attention. I want my people to do the same.”¹¹

***

**Power Becomes Personal**

> **2023 — Donald J. Trump — Fox News town hall**
>
> Hannity: “You would never abuse power?”
>
> Trump: “Except for day one.”¹²

***

**Institutions Become Enemies**

> **2017 — Donald J. Trump — Social media post**
>
> “The FAKE NEWS media… is the enemy of the American People!”¹³

***

**Control of Language Reaches Control of Process**

> **2026 — Donald J. Trump — Dan Bongino Show**
>
> “The Republicans should say, we want to take over. We should take over the voting, the voting in at least many — 15 places. The Republicans ought to nationalize the voting.”²⁵

***

**Federal Enforcement Enters Electoral Language**

> **2026 — Steve Bannon — War Room Podcast**
>
> “We’re going to have ICE surround the polls come November… We’re not going to sit here and allow you to steal the country again.”²⁶

***

**Law Becomes Enforcement**

> **2025 — Pam Bondi — Television interview**
>
> “We will come after you and we will prosecute you. We will find you.”¹⁴

***

**Fear and Fiction Become Political Strategy**

> **2024 — J.D. Vance — Social media post**
>
> “Reports now show that people have had their pets abducted and eaten by people who shouldn’t be in this country.”¹⁵
>
> **2024 — J.D. Vance — Television interview**
>
> “If I have to create stories so that the American media actually pays attention… then that’s what I’m going to do.”¹⁶

***

**Inside the Party, Voices Speak — Then Go Silent**

> **2015 — Lindsey Graham — CNN interview**
>
> “He’s a race-baiting, xenophobic, religious bigot.”¹⁸
>
> **2016 — Lindsey Graham — Public statement**
>
> “If we nominate Trump, we will get destroyed… and we will deserve it.”¹⁹
>
> **2020 — James Mattis — Public statement**
>
> “Donald Trump is the first president in my lifetime who does not try to unite the American people — does not even pretend to try.”²⁰
>
> **2023 — John Kelly — Interview**
>
> “He certainly falls into the general definition of fascist.”²¹
>
> **2021 — Liz Cheney — Congressional speech**
>
> “The President summoned this mob, assembled the mob, and lit the flame of this attack.”²²
>
> **2016 — Mitt Romney — Speech**
>
> “Donald Trump is a phony, a fraud… His promises are as worthless as a degree from Trump University.”²³

***

**The Military Establishment Restates Its Oath**

> **2020 — Mark Milley — Congressional testimony**
>
> “We do not take an oath to a king or a queen, or to a tyrant or dictator. We take an oath to the Constitution.”²⁴

***

The words remain.

Unedited.

Unexplained.

Standing alone.

The record is public.

The question is whether it will be remembered.

***

**Bibliography**

1. Donald J. Trump, campaign press release, December 7, 2015. Statement announcing proposed Muslim immigration ban.

2. Josh Dawsey, “Trump Derides Protections for Immigrants From ‘Shithole Countries,’” Washington Post, January 11, 2018. Reporting on immigration remarks during White House negotiations.

3. Donald J. Trump, Twitter post, July 14, 2019. Statements directed at four Democratic members of Congress.

4. Pete Hegseth, _American Crusade_ (New York: Center Street, 2020). Political book describing Islam and Western demographic conflict.

5. Stephen Miller, public immigration statement, 2025. Remarks about migration importing social conditions.

6. Reuters, December 16, 2023. Coverage of Trump’s “poisoning the blood” rally remark.

7. Donald J. Trump, Veterans Day speech, November 11, 2023. Remarks pledging to remove domestic political opponents.

8. Donald J. Trump, CPAC speech transcript, March 4, 2023. Political rally address defining leadership and retribution.

9. Donald J. Trump, Truth Social post, December 3, 2022. Post asserting election fraud and constitutional override implications.

10. Washington Post reporting, March 2018. Coverage of remarks praising authoritarian leadership longevity.

11. CBS News reporting, 2018. Coverage of Trump praising Kim Jong-un leadership authority.

12. Fox News Town Hall transcript, December 6, 2023. Interview discussing presidential power.

13. Donald J. Trump, Twitter post, February 17, 2017. Statement labeling major news media as enemies of the public.

14. Pam Bondi, televised interview transcript, 2025. Public warning language toward political opponents.

15. FactCheck.org, September 2024. Analysis of Vance’s immigrant crime claims.

16. CBS News interview, September 2024. Vance comments regarding media attention strategies.

17. Kristi Noem, public immigration remarks, 2025. Statement advocating broad travel restrictions following White House meeting.

18. CNN Interview Transcript, Lindsey Graham, December 8, 2015. Reaction to Muslim immigration restrictions.

19. Lindsey Graham, public statement, May 2016. Commentary on Republican nomination consequences.

20. James Mattis, public statement, June 3, 2020. Criticism of presidential leadership and national unity.

21. John Kelly interview, The Atlantic, October 2023. Commentary describing Trump’s leadership style.

22. Congressional Record, Liz Cheney, January 6 Committee remarks, 2021. Congressional speech on presidential responsibility.

23. Mitt Romney, University of Utah speech, March 3, 2016. Address criticizing Trump’s business and political record.

24. Congressional testimony, General Mark Milley, 2020. Statement affirming military loyalty to the Constitution.

25. Reuters, February 2, 2026. Reporting on Trump urging Republicans to nationalize election administration.

26. Talking Points Memo, February 2026. Reporting on Steve Bannon remarks advocating ICE presence at polling locations.
